pullRequest.title: Circularity detection, EmbeddedId and other fixes
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR contains :


changes in the way circularity is detected (AssociationKey + mappedBy),  introduces EntitySelectFetchByUniqueKeyInitializer  and fixes for some issues with EmbeddedId (circularity and PluralAttribute) commit


a fix for PluralAttribute manyToMany FK target part determination commit


a fix for fetching a ManyToOne  attribute using a join table using inner join when a left outer should be used instead commit


a fix for joined subclass discriminator column determination commit


and re-enables more tests.

nodes.bodyText: moving the declaration of 'fetches' before the above statement would improve code readability a little bit. As a general rule, putting variable declaration as near its usage as possible decrease human brain memorizing pressure, I think.
I am a little bit shamed to point out adding another space char after ( in the above new code would make the format more consistent. Super minor for sure.
I saw there is some code duplication above (283-284 vs 251-252). Maybe we can eliminate it to avoid changing both when future refactoring is needed.
we can save a pair of {} in the lambda, though not a big deal
I am pretty sure System.arrayCopy seems to be much more performant, though not a big deal.

It seems LinkedHashMap shares the same problem with HashMap in that the initialCapacity is not the same as expectedSize except the loadFactor is specified as 1. Only ConcurrentHashMap is immune with this annoying problem. If CollectionHelper doesn't support util static factory method for it, we might well create one there.
seems combining the above two if together in one if leads to better readability, though not a big deal
why not include columns into hashCode as well? It has been used in equals already. Keep from using it doesn't violate the consistency between hashCode and equals, but it is a little bit confusing.
I would use , columns=[...] instead of , columns={..} for '{}' is usually used for map. Not a big deal for sure.
Do we allow for the possibility that associationKeyColumns is mutable later? Otherwise Collections.singletonList() would be more appropriate and less confusing.

commit.message: Fix PluralAttribute manyToMany FK target part determination
Fix issue with fetch a ManyToOne with join table using inner join
Fix joined subclass discriminator column determination
EagerCollectionFetch generates collection and index fetches twice
Removed unnecessary visitedNavigablePath from LoaderSelectBuilder and added bidirectionalPropertyName for circularity detection

afterCommit.message: Removed unnecessary visitedNavigablePath from LoaderSelectBuilder and added bidirectionalPropertyName for circularity detection
